Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Group of Ibis Birds Statues
Description: A group of ibis birds is depicted on wooden bases. Their bodies are made of alabaster, while their beaks and feet are made of bronze. The eyes are made of red beads. The ibis birds are drawn in a state of tranquility, kneeling on their legs, which are extended forward. The ibis bird symbolizes Thoth, the god of science, knowledge and writing.
